content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the decreasing function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, negative, x cubed, minus 6 times x squared, minus 12 x, plus 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="f of 4, equals negative 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the inverse function of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is a correct expression for <math alttext="g prime of negative 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="g prime of negative 8, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator f prime of, negative 8, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="g prime of negative 8, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator f prime of 4, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="g prime of negative 8, equals, f prime of 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="g prime of negative 8, equals, f prime of negative 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="g prime of negative 8, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator f prime of 4, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
